section.title: The Apache Access Log Parser
section.para: The Apache Access Log Parser can parse the access log messages of the Apache HTTP Server. The &abbrev; application can separate these log messages to name-value pairs. For details on using value-pairs in &abbrev; see . The apache-accesslog-parser() supports both the Common Log Format and the Combined Log Format of Apache (for details, see the Apache HTTP Server documentation). The following is a sample log message:
The &abbrev; application extracts every field into name-value pairs, and adds the .apache. prefix to the name of the field.

The parser extracts the following fields from the messages: clientip, ident, auth, timestamp, rawrequest, response, bytes, referrer, and agent. The rawrequest field is further segmented into the verb, request, and httpversion fields. The &abbrev; apache-accesslog-parser() parser uses the same naming convention as Logstash.
